description: Buttery, moist, soft Vegan Cherry Muffins. Full of almond flavour & bursting with juicy cherries in every bite!
keywords: almond cherry muffins, cherry muffins recipes, vegan cherry muffins
name: Vegan Cherry Muffins
recipeIngredient: 250g / 2 cups all purpose flour (, see recipe notes for gluten-free option)
3 teaspoons baking powder (, it must be aluminum free for this recipe or your muffins will turn blue.)
1 1/2 cups / 336 grams fresh pitted, frozen or dried cherries

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 425°F and prepare a muffin tin. Either grease it or line with liners.
Add the flour, almond flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt to a bowl. Mix together well.
Add the almond extract, vinegar, apple sauce and milk (use milk ONLY if using all purpose flour and not oat flour), to another small bowl or jug and mix thoroughly.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir gently until it is just combined. Do not overmix.

Add the cherries and stir them gently through, then spoon the batter evenly into the prepared muffin tins so they are about 3/4 full. Sprinkle the tops with the flaked/slivered almonds and get into the oven as quickly as you can.

After 5 minutes in the oven turn the temperature down to 375°F (don't open the door) and cook for another 12 - 15 minutes. A tooth pick inserted into one of them should come out clean after that time. If it doesn't give them a minute or two more.
Once cooked leave for 5 minutes in the pan, then remove and transfer to a cooling rack.

video.description: Buttery, moist, soft Almond Cherry Muffins. Full of flavour & bursting with juicy cherries in every bite. And they can be made gluten-free!
video.name: Vegan Cherry Muffins
